Key Match Events: Quinton de Kock's blistering knock nearly handed South Africa victory over Zimbabwe before rain played spoilsport
South Africa were comfortably chasing a reduced target of 64 off seven overs
Sean Williams was run out (1) in the next over before the 53-run partnership between Wessly Madhevere and Milton Shumba brought some much-needed stability
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain played spoilsport in their T20 World Cup opener in Hobart on Monday and both teams ended up sharing the points
Bangladesh play South Africa in Sydney on Thursday, while the Netherlands face India
Others: Zimbabwe will play Pakistan in their next Super 12 match in Perth on Thursday
